oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Harmonically trapped fermions in two dimensions: ground-state energy and contact of SU(2) and SU(4) systems via nonuniform lattice Monte Carlo
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Luo, Z. -H.
Berger, C. E.
Drut, J. E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Condensed Matter - Quantum Gases
High Energy Physics - Lattice
Nuclear Theory
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We study harmonically trapped, unpolarized fermion systems with attractive interactions in two spatial dimensions with spin degeneracies Nf = 2 and 4 and N/Nf = 1, 3, 5, and 7 particles per flavor. We carry out our calculations using our recently proposed quantum Monte Carlo method on a nonuniform lattice. We report on the ground-state energy and contact for a range of couplings, as determined by the binding energy of the two-body system, and show explicitly how the physics of the Nf-body sector dominates as the coupling is increased.
